text: Almost spot on, however we're going a level deeper in this case. A shockingly small number of customers are even aware of that setting for CTAs, so very few people actually use it meaning if we used that it wouldn't work for enough people. We're going a step deeper and instead going to directly use the default COS domain, so that it'll work for all customers. Ideally this would replace the custom CTA tracking domain, likely in the short term, that way every customer gets that feature out of the box too

Whatever the solution is, it needs to work on sites that are external to HubSpot (ie: self-hosted WordPress) as well. Could the CTAs not come from a subdomain associated with the HubSpot account such as <http://cta.kulapartners.com|cta.kulapartners.com>?

That is possible, but this would mean that the hard coded links in the CTA would be to a domain that *must* remain connected to the portal. If the domain was disconnected, or if there were any temporary issues, the CTAs would completely fail. On a slightly more realistic example though, if you ever wanted to change the domain, every single CTA (and form, ideally these solutions apply to both) would need to be re-embedded on the site with the new domain name
<@U24DCSJBE> Wouldn’t be much different than hardcoded links that go to content. or blog. as many HS users, so I wouldn’t see that as an issue. Definitely a consideration, to be sure.
Could make that CTA a requirement for using the “self hosted CTAs”
Is there an ETA for role out of the new IDE? (please @ me on reply)
Q1 was the last i heard
We don't have a specific date yet, but we're targeting mid-to-late Q1 2018 <@U2SJA29B4>.
If you have a portal you want to get into the beta in the meantime, just add it here: <http://designers.HubSpot.com/design-manager-beta>
Signed up for the beta just now :slightly_smiling_face:
Fair point, Jeff, definitely worth considering.
So does anyone else not have external stylesheets loading? Like the <http://typography.com|typography.com> and others?
i have them in the head includes but its not rendering the code. Also I am in the beta design manager
Re: AdBlock... we've written a bit of JS to generate a fallback CTA link if HubSpot's JS is being blocked. Perhaps others may find it useful until the issues have been sorted.
